values.title: Automatically filter uploaded logs on portal

content.raw:
Request from DARPA review team: provide a 30Hz filtered state.log for each run. This would require automatically processing incoming files with `gzlog`, probably on the portal.

Not a requirement, but a quality of life nice to have.

Fallback is to prescribe procedure to let the review team do this manually on a log-by-log basis, via ssh access to the portal.
content.html:
Request from DARPA review team: provide a 30Hz filtered state.log for each run. This would require automatically processing incoming files with gzlog, probably on the portal.

Not a requirement, but a quality of life nice to have.

Fallback is to prescribe procedure to let the review team do this manually on a log-by-log basis, via ssh access to the portal.

values.title: Task launching not robust to network caps with commas

content.raw:
In testing, tasks were created by copying and pasting from the official run description documents, yielding strings with commas as the thousands separators. The `int` cast at  `cloudsimd/launchers/launch_utils/traffic_shapping.py:32` choked on that input.

For now, we'll just remember to not embed commas.  Would be better to be robust to comma-separate input.
content.html:
In testing, tasks were created by copying and pasting from the official run description documents, yielding strings with commas as the thousands separators. The int cast at cloudsimd/launchers/launch_utils/traffic_shapping.py:32 choked on that input.

For now, we'll just remember to not embed commas. Would be better to be robust to comma-separate input.

values.title: ROS topic communication not working OCU -> field

content.raw:
I'm unable to receive msgs from rostopic using a publisher in OCU and a listener in field1. Not blocked by bytecounter.

Steps in OCU
```
jrivero@quartz ~ $ export ROS_MASTER_URI=http://10.0.0.51:11311
jrivero@quartz ~ $ rostopic pub -r 10 /test std_msgs/Int8 12
```
Steps in field1
```
ubuntu@fc1-03:~$ . cloudsim/ros.bash
ubuntu@fc1-03:~$ rostopic info /test
Type: std_msgs/Int8

Publishers: 
 * /rostopic_5156_1369232420033 (http://quartz:35320/)

Subscribers: None

ubuntu@fc1-03:~$ rostopic echo /test
WARNING: no messages received and simulated time is active.
Is /clock being published?
```
It could be a problem in my end, but I want to be sure about this issue.
content.html:
I'm unable to receive msgs from rostopic using a publisher in OCU and a listener in field1. Not blocked by bytecounter.

Steps in OCU

jrivero@quartz ~ $ export ROS_MASTER_URI=http://10.0.0.51:11311
jrivero@quartz ~ $ rostopic pub -r 10 /test std_msgs/Int8 12

Steps in field1

ubuntu@fc1-03:~$ . cloudsim/ros.bash
ubuntu@fc1-03:~$ rostopic info /test
Type: std_msgs/Int8

Publishers: 
 * /rostopic_5156_1369232420033 (http://quartz:35320/)

Subscribers: None

ubuntu@fc1-03:~$ rostopic echo /test
WARNING: no messages received and simulated time is active.
Is /clock being published?

It could be a problem in my end, but I want to be sure about this issue.

values.title: gzclient not displaying image when connected to server in constellation

content.raw:
When I try to run gzclient in my local machine to connect through vpn to gzserver running on simulator, gzclient seems to be frozen, appears but no image is displayed, see image below. I can run gztopics list without problems. 

nightly version of drcsim and gazebo was installed in my machine.

Steps done:
```
... source all setup.sh involved in drcsim ...
jrivero@quartz ~ $ export GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://10.0.0.51:11345
jrivero@quartz ~ $ gzclient
```

![gzclient error](http://www.iri.upc.edu/people/jrivero/gzclient-error.png)

UPDATE: if I left open gzclient during some minutes some values of real time factor, and timing appear, but they are not being updated.
content.html:
When I try to run gzclient in my local machine to connect through vpn to gzserver running on simulator, gzclient seems to be frozen, appears but no image is displayed, see image below. I can run gztopics list without problems.

nightly version of drcsim and gazebo was installed in my machine.

Steps done:

... source all setup.sh involved in drcsim ...
jrivero@quartz ~ $ export GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=http://10.0.0.51:11345
jrivero@quartz ~ $ gzclient

UPDATE: if I left open gzclient during some minutes some values of real time factor, and timing appear, but they are not being updated.

values.title: Add /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh to router/ros.bash

content.raw: As [reported](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/3020/cloudsimsoftlayer-gzclient-fails-to-launch-on-ocu/), the generated `ros.bash` file in the `router.zip` isn't sufficient to configure the OCU-side environment.  Users also need to source `/usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh`.  It would be better to add that to the `router/ros.bash`.
content.html: As reported, the generated ros.bash file in the router.zip isn't sufficient to configure the OCU-side environment. Users also need to source /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh. It would be better to add that to the router/ros.bash.

content.raw:
From a cloudsimd log for a task with 0 for either the uplink or downlink caps:

~~~
monitoring log> score monitoring error float division by zero
monitoring log> traceback:  Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/var/cloudsimd/launchers/launch_utils/monitoring.py", line 330, in monitor_task
    up = 100.0 * up_bits / up_cap
ZeroDivisionError: float division by zero
~~~

From a cloudsimd log for a task with 0 for either the uplink or downlink caps:

monitoring log> score monitoring error float division by zero
monitoring log> traceback:  Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/var/cloudsimd/launchers/launch_utils/monitoring.py", line 330, in monitor_task
    up = 100.0 * up_bits / up_cap
ZeroDivisionError: float division by zero

values.title: Deleting a task while stopping causes inconsistent state

content.raw:
A team got their CloudSim into a state where no new tasks could be started.  On inspection of the redis database, `current_task` was set to a task ID that did not appear in the `tasks` list.  Logs demonstrate that the following sequence occurred:

* create task command issued
* task state: ready
* start task command issued
* task state: starting
* task state: running
* 17 hours elapsed
* stop task command issued
* task state: stopping
* delete task command issued, causing task to be removed from the `tasks` list
* task state: stopped

Cleanup in the last step failed because the task had already been removed from the list.  The delete button is/should be disabled in the web UI after issued the stop command, but the delete command is not locked out in the backend, so a second / stale web browser could have allowed the delete command to be issued.
content.html:
A team got their CloudSim into a state where no new tasks could be started. On inspection of the redis database, current_task was set to a task ID that did not appear in the tasks list. Logs demonstrate that the following sequence occurred:

  • create task command issued
  • task state: ready
  • start task command issued
  • task state: starting
  • task state: running
  • 17 hours elapsed
  • stop task command issued
  • task state: stopping
  • delete task command issued, causing task to be removed from the tasks list
  • task state: stopped

Cleanup in the last step failed because the task had already been removed from the list. The delete button is/should be disabled in the web UI after issued the stop command, but the delete command is not locked out in the backend, so a second / stale web browser could have allowed the delete command to be issued.

values.title: Consider protecting access to Deploy button

content.raw:
Since the reload step was moved into Terminate, Deploy (aka Launch) will now fail unless Terminate was the last thing that happened.  As a result, an admin or officer who logs into a CloudSim system with a running constellation can very easily break it by hitting "Deploy."

We should something to make that error more difficult to encounter.
content.html:
Since the reload step was moved into Terminate, Deploy (aka Launch) will now fail unless Terminate was the last thing that happened. As a result, an admin or officer who logs into a CloudSim system with a running constellation can very easily break it by hitting "Deploy."

We should something to make that error more difficult to encounter.

values.title: Make log-writing message more informative

content.raw:
From Seth:

would you consider
making the "writing log" message more informative?  As it
is now, there's no indication that useful work is happening
until the write completes.

Concretely, that web interface could display the log size,
the write rate, the amount/percentage written so far, and
an estimate of how much additional time the write will take.
content.html:
From Seth:

would you consider making the "writing log" message more informative? As it is now, there's no indication that useful work is happening until the write completes.

Concretely, that web interface could display the log size, the write rate, the amount/percentage written so far, and an estimate of how much additional time the write will take.

values.title: CloudSim is counting multicast packets sent from fc2 to fc1 in the up/downlink quotes

content.raw:
CloudSim is counting comms sent fc1 and fc2 in the up/downlink quotes. It should not.

I'd imagine you have tested this for ROS-based transmission, but our team uses UDP Multicast to pass data between fc1 and fc2 (specifcall the  LCM package).

When I transmit data from fc2 to fc1 its counted in my downlink volume.
For the bandwidth regimes mentioned in the document, when I re-transmit camera imagery internally, it uses up my bandwidth in about 5 seconds - despite none of the traffic leaving the SoftLayer site.

I don't notice the problem when transmitting from fc1 to fc2.
content.html:
CloudSim is counting comms sent fc1 and fc2 in the up/downlink quotes. It should not.

I'd imagine you have tested this for ROS-based transmission, but our team uses UDP Multicast to pass data between fc1 and fc2 (specifcall the LCM package).

When I transmit data from fc2 to fc1 its counted in my downlink volume. For the bandwidth regimes mentioned in the document, when I re-transmit camera imagery internally, it uses up my bandwidth in about 5 seconds - despite none of the traffic leaving the SoftLayer site.

I don't notice the problem when transmitting from fc1 to fc2.

values.title: Latency injection is not disabled at the end of the task
Explicit load of ixgbe module needs to escape call to `uname`

content.raw: When we [add the call to insmod](#!/osrf/cloudsim/src/dd27bedea0f59e94fc40bb571a0b9c2743c63046/cloudsimd/launchers/vrc_contest.py?at=default#cl-698) in `/etc/rc.local`, we need to escape the backquote characters, so that they appear literally in `/etc/rc.local`.  Otherwise, substitution happens when that file is created, resulting in a kernel version-specific path.  Then the module won't load properly if booted into a different kernel.
content.html: When we add the call to insmod in /etc/rc.local, we need to escape the backquote characters, so that they appear literally in /etc/rc.local. Otherwise, substitution happens when that file is created, resulting in a kernel version-specific path. Then the module won't load properly if booted into a different kernel.

values.title: stop_sim.bash infinite loop

content.raw:
Team B004 had a task that would not stop.

There was an error in gzlog  that crashed gazebo and stop_sim.bash was hung

potential solution:

If gazebo crashes when the log is written, the while loop that calls gzstat may become infinite. We also should check for a a "Terminated" result from gzstat so we can get out of the loop
content.html:
Team B004 had a task that would not stop.

There was an error in gzlog that crashed gazebo and stop_sim.bash was hung

potential solution:

If gazebo crashes when the log is written, the while loop that calls gzstat may become infinite. We also should check for a a "Terminated" result from gzstat so we can get out of the loop

values.title: Task does not stop

content.raw:
Simulator machine a better stop_sim.bash:



```
#!python

#!/bin/bash

MAX_TIME=30
echo `date` "Stop sim - Begin" >> /home/ubuntu/cloudsim/stop_sim.log
. /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh

if timeout -k 1 2 gztopic list; then 
  LOG_PATH=`ps aux | grep gzserver | grep -m 1 record_path | cut -d = -f 3 | cut -d ' ' -f 1`/state.log
  echo "  Log file: $LOG_PATH" >> /home/ubuntu/cloudsim/stop_sim.log 
  gzlog stop
  # Let cleanup start, which pauses the world
  sleep 5
  while [ "`timeout -k 1 1 gzstats -p 2>/dev/null |cut -d , -f 4 | tail -n 1`" != " F" ]; do
    sleep 1
    if [ "`ps aux | grep gzserver | wc -l`" == "1" ]; then
        echo "  gzserver died, force exit" >> /home/ubuntu/cloudsim/stop_sim.log
        break
    fi
    # look for the name of the Log file
    if [ "`tail -n 1 $LOG_PATH`" = "</gazebo_log>" ] ; then 
        echo "  Log end tag detected" >> /home/ubuntu/cloudsim/stop_sim.log
        break 
    fi
  done
fi
killall -INT roslaunch || true

tstart=$(date +%s)
# Block until all ros process are killed
while [ "`ps aux | grep ros | wc -l`" != "1" ]; do

    tnow=$(date +%s)
    if ((tnow-tstart>MAX_TIME)) ;then
        break
    fi

    sleep 1
done

# Kill all remaining ros processes
kill -9 $(ps aux | grep ros | awk '{print $2}') || true
killall -9 gzserver || true
```
content.html:
Simulator machine a better stop_sim.bash:

#!/bin/bash

MAX_TIME=30
echo `date` "Stop sim - Begin" >> /home/ubuntu/cloudsim/stop_sim.log
. /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh

if timeout -k 1 2 gztopic list; then 
  LOG_PATH=`ps aux | grep gzserver | grep -m 1 record_path | cut -d = -f 3 | cut -d ' ' -f 1`/state.log
  echo "  Log file: $LOG_PATH" >> /home/ubuntu/cloudsim/stop_sim.log 
  gzlog stop
  # Let cleanup start, which pauses the world
  sleep 5
  while [ "`timeout -k 1 1 gzstats -p 2>/dev/null |cut -d , -f 4 | tail -n 1`" != " F" ]; do
    sleep 1
    if [ "`ps aux | grep gzserver | wc -l`" == "1" ]; then
        echo "  gzserver died, force exit" >> /home/ubuntu/cloudsim/stop_sim.log
        break
    fi
    # look for the name of the Log file
    if [ "`tail -n 1 $LOG_PATH`" = "</gazebo_log>" ] ; then 
        echo "  Log end tag detected" >> /home/ubuntu/cloudsim/stop_sim.log
        break 
    fi
  done
fi
killall -INT roslaunch || true

tstart=$(date +%s)
# Block until all ros process are killed
while [ "`ps aux | grep ros | wc -l`" != "1" ]; do

    tnow=$(date +%s)
    if ((tnow-tstart>MAX_TIME)) ;then
        break
    fi

    sleep 1
done

# Kill all remaining ros processes
kill -9 $(ps aux | grep ros | awk '{print $2}') || true
killall -9 gzserver || true

values.title: Duplicate task and reset the state machine

content.raw:
If the simulator machine goes down in the middle of a task, there should be an easy way to:

- mark the task as stopped
- create a new task with the same settings, to be appended to the list of tasks
content.html:
If the simulator machine goes down in the middle of a task, there should be an easy way to:

  • mark the task as stopped
  • create a new task with the same settings, to be appended to the list of tasks

values.title: tasks aren't entered in order

content.raw: We've seen a couple of instance where `bin/send_tasks.py` does not preserve the order on the `task_sequence` in the YAML file it's given.  It just happened on constellation 09 when loading 300 tasks that should have been a repeating sequence 1,2,3.  Not sure whether some got lost, or whether they're all there and just out of order.
content.html: We've seen a couple of instance where bin/send_tasks.py does not preserve the order on the task_sequence in the YAML file it's given. It just happened on constellation 09 when loading 300 tasks that should have been a repeating sequence 1,2,3. Not sure whether some got lost, or whether they're all there and just out of order.

values.title: OpenStack dhcp

content.raw:
I'm having problems running the puppet-vagrant branch. I can install the software successfully, but I am not able to create instances with the correct IP. 

This was found in the log when trying to launch a cirros instance with the desired IPs: 
* 172.16.1.2
* 10.10.1.1

This problems seems to be in the vagrant virtual machine (since it is where OpenStack is installed), but it could also be a problem with the host (since it works on other machines)

Any thoughs?

```
#!bash

Starting network...
udhcpc (v1.20.1) started
Sending discover...
Sending select for 172.16.1.2...
Received DHCP NAK
Sending discover...
Sending select for 192.168.56.101...
Lease of 192.168.56.101 obtained, lease time 3600
cirros-ds 'net' up at 12.09
checking http://169.254.169.254/2009-04-04/instance-id
failed 1/20: up 12.46. request failed
failed 2/20: up 14.70. request failed
failed 3/20: up 16.97. request failed
failed 4/20: up 19.22. request failed
failed 5/20: up 21.46. request failed
failed 6/20: up 23.78. request failed
```

values.title: Remove unnecessary stuff from Task properties dialog

content.raw: NRI tutorial users don't need VRC parameters, and we could probably hide the Network parameters, too.
content.html: NRI tutorial users don't need VRC parameters, and we could probably hide the Network parameters, too.

values.title: revisit officer privileges

content.raw:
It would be convenient for officers to be able to:

* create tasks

but not:

* terminate or deploy constellations
content.html:
It would be convenient for officers to be able to:

  • create tasks

but not:

  • terminate or deploy constellations

values.title: gz3d and ipynotebook links should go to new tabs
gzweb and ipynotebook websockets not working in some versions of Chrome

content.raw:
With some versions of Chrome/Chromium, or perhaps on certain machines, the websocket connections to gzweb and ipynotebook fail.

Further testing suggests that the failure is related to whether the websocket is TLS-encrypted or not.  This test page:

 * http://www.websocket.org/echo.html

allows you to test your browser's websocket support, with a toggle to select whether to "Use secure WebSocket (TLS)."

For me:

* in Firefox (where I can connect to gzweb/ipynotebook), I can connect whether or not it's secure.
* in every version of Chrome/Chromium I've tried (where I can't connect to gzweb/ipynotebook), connecting without the secure option fails (connecting with the secure option succeeds).
content.html:
With some versions of Chrome/Chromium, or perhaps on certain machines, the websocket connections to gzweb and ipynotebook fail.

Further testing suggests that the failure is related to whether the websocket is TLS-encrypted or not. This test page:

  • http://www.websocket.org/echo.html

allows you to test your browser's websocket support, with a toggle to select whether to "Use secure WebSocket (TLS)."

For me:

  • in Firefox (where I can connect to gzweb/ipynotebook), I can connect whether or not it's secure.
  • in every version of Chrome/Chromium I've tried (where I can't connect to gzweb/ipynotebook), connecting without the secure option fails (connecting with the secure option succeeds).

values.title: CloudSim (stable) does not start

content.raw: For some reason, launch_common() does no exist anymore.
content.html: For some reason, launch_common() does no exist anymore.

values.title: Intermittent security group error on launch

content.raw:
With CloudSim pre-1.7, I'm getting intermittent failed launches of Simulator-stable constellations with an error about a non-existent security group.  I'll paste the traceback here next time it happens.

Talking to @hugomatic, it seems likely that there's a retry loop missing in the non-VPC code path.

Marking as relevant for the NRI Tutorial because if this happens often enough it will hinder our ability to launch a bunch of constellations.
content.html:
With CloudSim pre-1.7, I'm getting intermittent failed launches of Simulator-stable constellations with an error about a non-existent security group. I'll paste the traceback here next time it happens.

Talking to @hugomatic, it seems likely that there's a retry loop missing in the non-VPC code path.

Marking as relevant for the NRI Tutorial because if this happens often enough it will hinder our ability to launch a bunch of constellations.

values.title: When running from a simulator constellation, the score line is not displayed and timeout has no effect.
Better basic auth support

content.raw:
With the basic auth support in place, there are a few problems:
* users can't be managed from the GUI

A password and a confirm password textbox should be added to the ui when basic auth is used.
content.html:
With the basic auth support in place, there are a few problems: * users can't be managed from the GUI

A password and a confirm password textbox should be added to the ui when basic auth is used.

values.title: create_cloudsim is broken

content.raw:
in CloudSim 1.7.0

The workaround is to follow the developper' tutorial:
* install CloudSIm locally by running the deploy script
* use the local CloudSim to launch  another CloudSim in the cloud
http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/CloudSim/development
content.html:
in CloudSim 1.7.0

The workaround is to follow the developper' tutorial: install CloudSIm locally by running the deploy script use the local CloudSim to launch another CloudSim in the cloud http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/CloudSim/development

values.title: CloudSim instances launch refactor

content.raw:
Simulator instances and CloudSim instances use different code paths to launch the servers. 
CloudSim provisioning should be refactored to:
 - use the newer method to launch the instance
 - use constellation specific credentials (instead of the global ones)

This will finish the necessary changes to have a CloudSim web kiosk, a web site where users can put in their AWS credentials and launch CloudSim instances without installing any software.
content.html:
Simulator instances and CloudSim instances use different code paths to launch the servers. CloudSim provisioning should be refactored to: - use the newer method to launch the instance - use constellation specific credentials (instead of the global ones)

This will finish the necessary changes to have a CloudSim web kiosk, a web site where users can put in their AWS credentials and launch CloudSim instances without installing any software.

values.title: Simplify task UI

content.raw:
The create task ui had too many parmeters. Most of them were hidden for the NRI.
The parameters should be grouped in tabs
content.html: The create task ui had too many parmeters. Most of them were hidden for the NRI. The parameters should be grouped in tabs

values.title: support basic auth for create_cloudsim

content.raw: It should be possible to launch a basic auth CloudSim instance using create_cloudsim.
content.html: It should be possible to launch a basic auth CloudSim instance using create_cloudsim.

values.title: Reset task does not reinitialize task button states

content.raw: If you use the "Reset task" button, tasks are reset but the button states are not.
content.html: If you use the "Reset task" button, tasks are reset but the button states are not.

values.title: Tabs are broken when editing and existing task
CloudSIm breaks apache web server

content.raw:
When Apache is deployed on a machine that has Apache installed, it replaces the local /etc/apache2/apache2.conf.

This breaks stuff. 

Also, with the growing number of configs, (basic, openid and, soon, ssl), we should move to proper multi-site support.
content.html:
When Apache is deployed on a machine that has Apache installed, it replaces the local /etc/apache2/apache2.conf.

This breaks stuff.

Also, with the growing number of configs, (basic, openid and, soon, ssl), we should move to proper multi-site support.

values.title: Add a true stable CloudSim configuration w/o updates

content.raw: in pull request #152, latest updates will now be applied on top of the `CloudSim-stable` AMI. This no longer keeps it "stable". Consider making another configuration something like `CloudSim-stable-update` for this.
content.html: in pull request #152, latest updates will now be applied on top of the CloudSim-stable AMI. This no longer keeps it "stable". Consider making another configuration something like CloudSim-stable-update for this.

values.title: iPython notebook should be independent of gzWeb

content.raw:
It does not need to be restarted with a simulation.
A separate CloudSim widget should be used to start / stop the service.
content.html: It does not need to be restarted with a simulation. A separate CloudSim widget should be used to start / stop the service.

values.title: cloudsim tarball fails to create

content.raw:
When launching a CloudSim instance from the CloudSim Web app.

The entire /var directory is zipped and part of the source (cloudsim/inside) is missing.
content.html:
When launching a CloudSim instance from the CloudSim Web app.

The entire /var directory is zipped and part of the source (cloudsim/inside) is missing.

values.title: Simulator fails to provision

content.raw: The /etc/environment file is written to prior to drcsim installation, and ROS fails to install because /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh is not found
content.html: The /etc/environment file is written to prior to drcsim installation, and ROS fails to install because /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh is not found

values.title: Stop task show wrong message

content.raw:
When resetting tasks, the status shows the following:
"Ready to _run_cloudsim_cmd_loop"
content.html: When resetting tasks, the status shows the following: "Ready to _run_cloudsim_cmd_loop"

values.title: move the ami IDs to a configuration file

content.raw: Along with the puppet files.
content.html: Along with the puppet files.

values.title: Termination timeout

content.raw:
When terminating a [simulator] constellation, the operation times-out if the machine has been terminated previously in the AWS console.

This is because for the instance dissapears from AWS after 20 minutes or so, and the terminate operation expects it.

The termination should finish early if AWS reports that the machine(s) does not exist.
content.html:
When terminating a [simulator] constellation, the operation times-out if the machine has been terminated previously in the AWS console.

This is because for the instance dissapears from AWS after 20 minutes or so, and the terminate operation expects it.

The termination should finish early if AWS reports that the machine(s) does not exist.

values.title: Wrong IP address in the ssh script

content.raw:
The downloaded ssh script connects to the VPN address (10.0.0.5x) for constellations that are using a single machine (Simulator and Simulator stable)

The generator for that script needs to be updated.
content.html:
The downloaded ssh script connects to the VPN address (10.0.0.5x) for constellations that are using a single machine (Simulator and Simulator stable)

The generator for that script needs to be updated.

values.title: Add region selection support

content.raw:
With the growing number of machine types used by constellations, some constellations will not be available in every region.

Also, for cg1.4xlarge machines, preferred availability zones must be specified for certain regions.

The current AWS account is locked to a single region/availability zone. Regions should be decoupled from the account and preferred availability zones should be specified in the settings.
content.html:
With the growing number of machine types used by constellations, some constellations will not be available in every region.

Also, for cg1.4xlarge machines, preferred availability zones must be specified for certain regions.

The current AWS account is locked to a single region/availability zone. Regions should be decoupled from the account and preferred availability zones should be specified in the settings.

values.title: REST API enhancements

content.raw:
At the moment, It is not possible to:
    list tasks, or a 
    start_task_by_name
content.html: At the moment, It is not possible to: list tasks, or a start_task_by_name

content.raw:
For Simulator constellations.

- Add support for Oregon region
- Fix Nvidia drivers installation.
content.html:
For Simulator constellations.

  • Add support for Oregon region
  • Fix Nvidia drivers installation.

values.title: Can't add new admin user in (Basic  auth)

content.raw: The user appears on the list but the password does not make it to the htpasswd file.
content.html: The user appears on the list but the password does not make it to the htpasswd file.

values.title: Add optional bash script to task

content.raw:
Before executing a task, the environment needs to be configured appropriately.

For DRCSIM, this is done automatically. However, when creating custom simulations (or supporting multiple simulations in parallel), there should be a way to setup the environment.

Solution: Add a field to run a bash command before invoking the ROS launch.

To think about: making ROSlaunch optional.
content.html:
Before executing a task, the environment needs to be configured appropriately.

For DRCSIM, this is done automatically. However, when creating custom simulations (or supporting multiple simulations in parallel), there should be a way to setup the environment.

Solution: Add a field to run a bash command before invoking the ROS launch.

To think about: making ROSlaunch optional.

values.title: Users ahould not be able to start/stop gzweb or ipython notebook

content.raw: Only admins and officers should
content.html: Only admins and officers should

values.title: Better test for gzweb ping

content.raw:
ping_gzweb.bash should be improved to check for the http server state.

Both servers could also be combine.
content.html:
ping_gzweb.bash should be improved to check for the http server state.

Both servers could also be combine.

values.title: No region displayed for constellation

content.raw: Constellations can be launched in different regions. However, a running constellation does not display its region. It would be useful to determine the region.
content.html: Constellations can be launched in different regions. However, a running constellation does not display its region. It would be useful to determine the region.

values.title: Improve messages during constellation creation

content.raw:
Since the starting process is taking a while, one idea is to remove the message:

```
ls: cannot access cloudsim/setup/done: No such file or directory
```

so the user does not think about a problem in his end and just wait relaxing. Something like:

```
ssh localhost 'ls cloudsimd/setup/done 2>/dev/null || echo "Still waiting to the remote machine, please be patient"'
```
should work.
content.html:
Since the starting process is taking a while, one idea is to remove the message:

ls: cannot access cloudsim/setup/done: No such file or directory

so the user does not think about a problem in his end and just wait relaxing. Something like:

ssh localhost 'ls cloudsimd/setup/done 2>/dev/null || echo "Still waiting to the remote machine, please be patient"'

should work.

values.title: Grey screen on gzweb on firefox and chrome

content.raw:
I'm using Ubuntu precise and after creating the task following the [notebook camcorder tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/CloudSim/notebook_camcorder) and click on the 3D viewer, I only get a grey screen in both firefox and chrome:

![gzweb.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/z8q4do/images/776100141-gzweb.png)

All the bubbles in the simulator are in blue.
content.html:
I'm using Ubuntu precise and after creating the task following the notebook camcorder tutorial and click on the 3D viewer, I only get a grey screen in both firefox and chrome:

All the bubbles in the simulator are in blue.

values.title: create_cloudsim.py final console output should include link to AWS console

content.raw:
Partway through the output from `create_cloudsim.py`,  I see this helpful message:

~~~
CloudSim ready. Visit http://54.80.76.130 

Stop your CloudSim using the AWS console
     http://aws.amazon.com/console/
~~~

Then there's much more output, followed by this less pretty message that offers partially overlapping information, but no link to the AWS console for termination:

~~~
CloudSim ready at ip 54.80.76.130, user: gerkey@osrfoundation.org
~~~

The final message should have everything, and should look nice (e.g., the earlier message is partly colored, which is good).
content.html:
Partway through the output from create_cloudsim.py, I see this helpful message:

CloudSim ready. Visit http://54.80.76.130 

Stop your CloudSim using the AWS console
     http://aws.amazon.com/console/

Then there's much more output, followed by this less pretty message that offers partially overlapping information, but no link to the AWS console for termination:

CloudSim ready at ip 54.80.76.130, user: gerkey@osrfoundation.org

The final message should have everything, and should look nice (e.g., the earlier message is partly colored, which is good).

values.title: create_cloudsim.py should be quiet by default

content.raw:
The console output from `create_cloudsim.py` is very verbose.  Now that we're advising users to run it, it should be quiet by default, just giving enough output to indicate progress, errors, and/or completion.

A `--verbose` or similar argument would re-enable the current behavior for developers who want to see everything happen.
content.html:
The console output from create_cloudsim.py is very verbose. Now that we're advising users to run it, it should be quiet by default, just giving enough output to indicate progress, errors, and/or completion.

A --verbose or similar argument would re-enable the current behavior for developers who want to see everything happen.

values.title: `Stop current task...` button shouldn't have the ellipsis

content.raw: Because it ends in `...`, I expected clicking that button to produce a dialog or confirmation of some sort.  But it just executes the stop immediately.  The `...` should be removed to make it clear that the action will be immediate.
content.html: Because it ends in ..., I expected clicking that button to produce a dialog or confirmation of some sort. But it just executes the stop immediately. The ... should be removed to make it clear that the action will be immediate.

values.title: AWS tutorial needs updating

content.raw: To reflect the move to AWS IAM identities.
content.html: To reflect the move to AWS IAM identities.

values.title: stacking issue when landing page resized

content.raw: When I resize the website, the double rainbow image stacks above the corresponding text. It should stack below.
content.html: When I resize the website, the double rainbow image stacks above the corresponding text. It should stack below.

values.title: Vertically center icons/images on website

content.html: The icons/images corresponding to each block of text are not vertically centering. Help!

values.title: Customizing constellation deployment

content.raw:
Hello Everyone,

I am a new cloudsim user, and although I tried to read all the possible documentation on the wiki (http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/CloudSim) and the bit-bucket issues, I have some questions that I couldn't find an answer for. Before asking the question, I want to say that the cloudsim is a very nice tool. Making servers on the fly for simulation is very useful.

I use ROS ang Gazebo frequently, but I am not a DRC participant/user. So I have my own robot model + a separate repository for my code. 

Is it possible for me to customize the cloudsim installation process to also include my own gazebo model + my repository and set the environment to use them accordingly? 
By looking at the code I think part of the installation process is done in the cloudsimd folder, but I don't exactly know where.
content.html:
Hello Everyone,

I am a new cloudsim user, and although I tried to read all the possible documentation on the wiki (http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/CloudSim) and the bit-bucket issues, I have some questions that I couldn't find an answer for. Before asking the question, I want to say that the cloudsim is a very nice tool. Making servers on the fly for simulation is very useful.

I use ROS ang Gazebo frequently, but I am not a DRC participant/user. So I have my own robot model + a separate repository for my code.

Is it possible for me to customize the cloudsim installation process to also include my own gazebo model + my repository and set the environment to use them accordingly? By looking at the code I think part of the installation process is done in the cloudsimd folder, but I don't exactly know where.

values.title: OpenID authentication did not work

content.raw:
Hi, 

I followed http://wiki.gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/CloudSim/setup and created Google OpenID authentication based cloudsim, but when I open the URL and push LogIn button it said as follows. 
Do I have to add "registered domain" to google account?

Learn more point to -> https://developers.google.com/accounts/docs/OpenID
```
#!shell

400. That’s an error.

OpenID auth request contains an unregistered domain: http://54.234.176.64/cloudsim/inside/cgi-bin/

Learn more
That’s all we know.
```
content.html:
Hi,

I followed http://wiki.gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/CloudSim/setup and created Google OpenID authentication based cloudsim, but when I open the URL and push LogIn button it said as follows. Do I have to add "registered domain" to google account?

Learn more point to -> https://developers.google.com/accounts/docs/OpenID

400. That’s an error.

OpenID auth request contains an unregistered domain: http://54.234.176.64/cloudsim/inside/cgi-bin/

Learn more
That’s all we know.

values.title: Tutorial pages are missing

content.raw: It seems http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/CloudSim/setup and http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/CloudSim/development are missing (and CloudSim's README is a bit bare). I would very much like to set up a new instance, but need a bit of direction. Thanks!
content.html: It seems http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/CloudSim/setup and http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/CloudSim/development are missing (and CloudSim's README is a bit bare). I would very much like to set up a new instance, but need a bit of direction. Thanks!
